result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Activity:Preliminary hearing/arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:05 AM Defendant Christopher Jerry Stevens in court by video with attorney Melissa Anne Frost by video.  David S Olson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
Justice Point: Rock County Supervision  Report
Adjourned initial appearance on May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Jerry Stevens
Current: 731 S. Wuthering Hills Dr., Janesville, WI 53546 United States  (Effective: 05-18-2022)
Prior: 822 1/2 5Th Street, Beloit, WI 53511

Activity: Indigency hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:53 AM Defendant Christopher Jerry Stevens in court by video with attorney Melissa Anne Frost in person.  Kyle Edward Johnson appearedin person for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant is still indigent and appoints attorney Melissa Frost.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Indigency hearing on May 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:36 PM Defendant Christopher Jerry Stevens in court by video in custody with attorney Melissa Anne Frost by video.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video with legal intern Margaret Ginocchio by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No driving without valid drivers license or valid insurance.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Matter to be set for indigency hearing.
